title: Uniform Fiduciary Access to Digital Assets Act
context: [ยง556A-2] Definitions. In this chapter: &ldquo;Account&rdquo; means an arrangement under a terms-of-service agreement in which a custodian carries, maintains, processes, receives, or stores a digital asset of the user or provides goods or services to the user. &ldquo;Agent&rdquo; means an attorney-in-fact granted authority under a durable or nondurable power of attorney. &ldquo;Carries&rdquo; means engages in the transmission of an electronic communication. &ldquo;Catalogue of electronic communications&rdquo; means information that identifies each person with which a user has had an electronic communication, the time and date of the communication, and the electronic address of the person. &ldquo;Conservator&rdquo; means a person appointed by a court to manage the estate of a living individual. The term includes a limited conservator. &ldquo;Content of an electronic communication&rdquo; means information concerning the substance or meaning of the communication which: (1) Has been sent or received by a user; (2) Is in electronic storage by a custodian providing an electronic communication service to the public or is carried or maintained by a custodian providing a remote computing service to the public; and (3) Is not readily accessible to the public. &ldquo;Court&rdquo; means the circuit court in this State having jurisdiction in matters relating to powers of attorney, in the case of a fiduciary or agent acting under a will or power of attorney; a circuit court in this State having jurisdiction in matters relating to the affairs of decedents, in the case of a personal representative; a circuit court in this State having jurisdiction in matters relating to the affairs of decedents or the family court, depending on which court has subject matter jurisdiction under section 560:5-106, in the case of a conservatorship; or a court that has jurisdiction under section 560:7-204, in the case of a trustee acting under a trust. &ldquo;Custodian&rdquo; means a person that carries, maintains, processes, receives, or stores a digital asset of a user. &ldquo;Designated recipient&rdquo; means a person chosen by a user using an online tool to administer digital assets of the user. &ldquo;Digital asset&rdquo; means an electronic record in which an individual has a right or interest. The term does not include an underlying asset or liability unless the asset or liability is itself an electronic record. &ldquo;Electronic&rdquo; means relating to technology having electrical, digital, magnetic, wireless, optical, electromagnetic, or similar capabilities. &ldquo;Electronic communication&rdquo; has the meaning set forth in title 18 U.S.C. section 2510(12). &ldquo;Electronic communication service&rdquo; means a custodian that provides to a user the ability to send or receive an electronic communication. &ldquo;Fiduciary&rdquo; means an original, additional, or successor personal representative, conservator, agent, or trustee. &ldquo;Information&rdquo; means data, text, images, videos, sounds, codes, computer programs, software, databases, or the like. &ldquo;Online tool&rdquo; means an electronic service provided by a custodian that allows the user, in an agreement distinct from the terms-of-service agreement between the custodian and user, to provide directions for disclosure or nondisclosure of digital assets to a third person. &ldquo;Person&rdquo; means an individual, estate, business or nonprofit entity, public corporation, government or governmental subdivision, agency, or instrumentality, or other legal entity. &ldquo;Personal representative&rdquo; means an executor, administrator, special administrator, or person that performs substantially the same function under the law of this State other than this chapter. &ldquo;Power of attorney&rdquo; means a record that grants an agent authority to act in the place of a principal. &ldquo;Principal&rdquo; means an individual who grants authority to an agent in a power of attorney. &ldquo;Protected person&rdquo; means an individual for whom a conservator has been appointed. The term includes an individual for whom an application for the appointment of a conservator is pending. &ldquo;Record&rdquo; means information that is inscribed on a tangible medium or that is stored in an electronic or other medium and is retrievable in perceivable form. &ldquo;Remote computing service&rdquo; means a custodian that provides to a user computer-processing services or the storage of digital assets by means of an electronic communications system, as defined in title 18 U.S.C. section 2510(14). &ldquo;Terms-of-service agreement&rdquo; means an agreement that controls the relationship between a user and a custodian. &ldquo;Trustee&rdquo; means a fiduciary with legal title to property under an agreement or declaration that creates a beneficial interest in another. The term includes a successor trustee. &ldquo;User&rdquo; means a person that has an account with a custodian. &ldquo;Will&rdquo; includes a codicil, testamentary instrument that only appoints an executor, and instrument that revokes or revises a testamentary instrument. [L 2016, c 162, pt of ยง1]
